body.p: What type of error could the researchers have made?

response.name: stronger
response.feedback: That’s incorrect. If the researchers had made a type I error, they would have rejected the null hypothesis and claimed that there was a significant difference between the group of women who received the hormone therapy and those who did not. Please try again.

response.name: weaker
response.feedback: Correct. With a type II error, researchers fail to reject a null hypothesis that is false. In this study, the researchers have not rejected the null hypothesis. Thus, the researchers have concluded that there is no significant difference in heart disease and breast cancer rates between the two groups. In reality, it is possible that there may have been a significant difference.

response.name: about the same
response.feedback: Incorrect. Each type of error relates to a specific conclusion from the hypothesis test. We have to reject the null hypothesis to make a type I error. We have to fail to reject the null hypothesis to make a type II error. What conclusion did the researchers make? Based on this conclusion, please try again.

part.hint: Remember, you are trying to determine what type of error—type I or type II—the researchers could have made based on the data.
A type I error is possible only if we reject the H0. A type II error is possible only if we fail to reject the H0.
